page.title: 01General Review
page.content: An area of undulating land (100m at Clopton) drained by R. Glem, tributary of River Stour. Denston (Population 120) Stansfield (250) and Hawkedon (140) parish churches all in Glem Valley except for Water-Meadows along Glem and 3 sq. km.orchards (mainly apple) and soft fruit near Clopton. Land is fertile, arable - mostly wheat and barley in 1985. Four fine ancient houses: Purton Hall (1167?) owned by Landmark Trust is not served by any made-up road, but is let to visitors who wish to enjoy the delights of rural Suffolk. Cordell Hall is nearby. Clopton Hall, home of the late Juston Brooke who planted the orchards now extending for hundred of acres.
